org.waarp.openr66.context.task.javatask

Class AddDigestJavaTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.waarp.openr66.context.task.AbstractExecJavaTask
      • org.waarp.openr66.context.task.javatask.AddDigestJavaTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, R66Runnable

    public class AddDigestJavaTask
extends AbstractExecJavaTask
    Add a digest in the TransferInformation to the current Task.
    This should be called on caller side in pre-task since the transfer information will be transfered just after.
    The second argument is -digest followed by one of ADLER32 CRC32 MD2 MD5 SHA1 SHA256 SHA384 SHA512, default being MD5.
    The third argument, optional, is "-format" followed by a string containing "#DIGEST#" to be replaced by the digest and starting with - or +, meaning this will be added at the beginning or the end of the generated new string. Default is equivalent to "-format -##DIGEST##".

    To be called as: EXECJAVAorg.waarp.openr66.context.task.javatask.AddDigestJavaTask -digest ADLER32|CRC32|MD2|MD5|SHA1|SHA256|SHA384|SHA512 [-format (-/+)##DIGEST##]
